required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of KN026 Combined With KN046 in Patients With Locally Advanced HER2-positive Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II, Open-Label, Multi-Center Study to Evaluate Efficacy, Safety and Tolerability of KN026 in Combination With KN046 in Patients With Locally Advanced Unresectable or Metastatic HER2-positive Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open-label, phase II，multi-center study to evaluate the efficacy, safety and tolerability of KN026 in combination with KN046 in subjects with HER2-positive solid tumors.

detailed_description.textblock: KN026 is an anti-HER2 bispecific antibody that can simultaneously bind two non-overlapping epitopes of HER2, leading to a dual HER2 signal blockade.KN046 is a PD-L1 - CTLA-4 bispecific antibody. The study composes of two stages. The first stage plans to enroll HER2-positive solid tumors. All subjects will be treated with KN026 at 30 mg/kg Q3W in combination with KN046 at 5 mg/kg Q3W at the first stage.A SMC meeting will decide whether to proceed to the nest stage.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the duration of the study; up to 2 years
primary_outcome.description: Objective response rate as assessed by the investigator according to RECIST 1.1 criteria

primary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the duration of the study; up to 2 years
primary_outcome.description: Duration of response (DOR) as assessed by the investigator according to RECIST 1.1 criteria

secondary_outcome.time_frame: CBR calculated as the proportion of subjects with best overall response of CR, PR, or SD ≥24 weeks

intervention.description: 30 mg/kg Q3W KN026+ 5 mg/kg Q3W KN046
